info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A RAPIDLY DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL KENTON, NORTHERN CAMPBELL, SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON, NORTHERN CLERMONT AND SOUTHEASTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 701 PM EDT, a rapidly developing thunderstorm was located over Mariemont, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Norwood, Fort Thomas, Newport, Madeira, Highland Heights, Milford, Taylor Mill, Bellevue, Dayton, Southgate, Forestville, Mariemont, Wilder, Williamsburg, Terrace Park, Batavia, Silver Grove and Melbourne. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 12. I-75 in Kentucky near mile marker 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
